meanings.definition: In a way that shows shame or embarrassment.
meanings.sent1: She looked down ashamedly when she realized her mistake.
meanings.sent2: He blushed ashamedly after being caught in a lie.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail ashamedly after chewing up the shoes.
meanings.sent4: The student spoke ashamedly, knowing he had cheated on the test.
meanings.sent5: The criminal hung his head ashamedly as he was led away in handcuffs.

meanings.sent1: The confident speaker stood proudly, not ashamedly, in front of the audience.
meanings.sent2: She accepted the award with an unashamedly joyful expression.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted around the room unashamedly knocking things off the table.
meanings.sent4: The politician spoke unashamedly about his controversial views.
meanings.sent5: The artist displayed her work unashamedly, proud of her unique style.
